name: humanization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of making something less unpleasant and more suitable for people: Their goal was the humanization of international relations. Touch screens have been part of the humanization of technology.
the process of showing that someone has the qualities, weaknesses, etc. that are typical of a human, in a way that makes you more likely to feel sympathy for them : He describes the purpose of the story as the humanization of an anti-hero.
the process of making something that is not human seem like a person, or treating something that is not human as if it is a person: the humanization of pets by their owners. See
humanize
More examplesFewer examplesThe policy promotes humanization of the prison system.The humanization of participants made them more willing to find compromise.The film portrays the humanization of a figure skater often regarded as a villain.The car had a kind of baby face and it was the humanization of the car that made it so popular.
